sentences.en: But when in thee time's furrows I behold , Then look I death my expiate.
sentences.cn: 但当你脸上出现时光的深槽,我就盼死神来了结我的天年.

sentences.en: Even death would not expiate all his crimes.
He had a chance to confess and expiate his guilt.
sentences.cn: 他有认错和赎罪的机会。

sentences.en: He tried to expiate his crimes by giving money to the church.
sentences.cn: 他以捐款给教会来赎罪.

sentences.en: I do not wish to expiate, but to live.
sentences.cn: 我不想赎罪, 只想生活.

sentences.en: It seemed that Alice was expiating her father's sins with her charity work.
sentences.cn: 看来爱丽丝要用自己的善行来赎她父亲的罪恶。

sentences.en: Now I was to expiate all my offences at the gallows.
sentences.cn: 现在我将在绞刑架上赎我一切的罪过.

sentences.en: She expiated her crime by becoming a nun.
The latter's expiate a guilt that was in retrospect vastly exaggerated or nonexistent prolonged the war.
sentences.cn: 后面这种人急于赎罪的心情把战争拖长了. 但回过头来看,这种罪名或者是完全会夸大了,或者根本就不存在.

sentences.en: Then look I death my expiate.
sentences.cn: 我就盼死神来了结我的天年.

trans.tran_en: If you expiate guilty feelings or bad behaviour, you do something to indicate that you are sorry for what you have done

trans.tran_cn: <正>为（所犯罪过）接受惩罚，赎（罪）
